intro: Hemitelia extensa, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length, with a glossy, dark green surface. Its flowering stems produce clusters of small, white spadices, typical of the Araceae family. Hemitelia extensa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
